main event: A civilian pilot observed a string of lights in the sky for about 3-5 seconds near Elburn, Illinois on 12 August 1959.
interesting points: The objects appeared as either three or four lights which seemed to merge into one before disappearing., The objects were observed at an altitude of around 30,000 feet., The pilot reported a bright daylight condition at the time of the sighting., The sighting lasted for a very short duration of time, making it difficult to draw firm conclusions about the nature of the objects observed., The conclusion initially suggested was that the sighting could have been balloons due to insufficient data for proper evaluation.
sighted object: a string of lights in the sky
